COCHETON (cont'd) Good. You understand -

dialogues.speaker: DR. LEPAGE
dialogues.text: (as he enters) Good morning, good morning. My name’s Alain Lepage, I’m your neurologist. You know Dr. Cocheton, of course. (sits on the bed) Jean-Dominique - no, no, your friends call you Jean-Do, so that’s what I’m going call you. Jean-Do. Because | want you to think of me as your friend, and as your friend... (smiles and then becomes serious) Jean-Do, | know how difficult this is for you. | also know that nobody has explained to you the full extent of your condition. Well, that's myjob. Yes. My job. (accepts the burden witha sentimental smile) You've had what we call a cerebrovascular accident. It's put your brain stem out of action. The brain stem is an essential component of our internal computer, the link between the brain and the spinal cord. \n the past, we would have said you'd had a massive stroke. You would very probably have died. But now we have such improved resuscitation techniques that we're able to prolong life. JEAN-DO’S VOICE Is this life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: JEAN-DO'S VOICE
